segment.source: Introduction to Xbox One tools
segment.target: Introduction to Xbox One tools

segment.source: The Xbox One-specific tool Dev Home, using the Windows Device Portal.
segment.target: The Xbox One-specific tool Dev Home, using the Windows Device Portal.

segment.source: Introduction to Xbox One tools
segment.target: Introduction to Xbox One tools

segment.source: This section covers the Xbox One-specific tool Dev Home, using the Windows Device Portal.
segment.target: This section covers the Xbox One-specific tool Dev Home, using the Windows Device Portal.

segment.source: Dev Home
segment.target: Dev Home

segment.source: Dev Home is a tools experience on the Xbox One Development Kit designed to aid developer productivity.
segment.target: Dev Home is a tools experience on the Xbox One Development Kit designed to aid developer productivity.

segment.source: Dev Home offers functionality to manage and configure your dev kit.
segment.target: Dev Home offers functionality to manage and configure your dev kit.

segment.source: To open Dev Home, select the Dev Home tile on the home screen.
segment.target: To open Dev Home, select the Dev Home tile on the home screen.

segment.source: If there is no tile present, the console is not in Developer Mode.
segment.target: If there is no tile present, the console is not in Developer Mode.

segment.source: Windows Device Portal
segment.target: Windows Device Portal

segment.source: User interface
segment.target: User interface

segment.source: The Dev Home user interface is divided into the areas described in the following sections.
segment.target: The Dev Home user interface is divided into the areas described in the following sections.

segment.source: Note the console IP address and friendly name are displayed here.
segment.target: Note the console IP address and friendly name are displayed here.

segment.source: DevHome UI
segment.target: DevHome UI

segment.source: Header
segment.target: Header

segment.source: The header contains important “at a glance” information about the dev kit.
segment.target: The header contains important “at a glance” information about the dev kit.

segment.source: This includes the console name, its IP address, the Xbox Live sandbox it is in, and the version of the operating system it is running.
segment.target: This includes the console name, its IP address, the Xbox Live sandbox it is in, and the version of the operating system it is running.

segment.source: On the right of the header, the current system time and date is shown for convenience.
segment.target: On the right of the header, the current system time and date is shown for convenience.

segment.source: Tool windows
segment.target: Tool windows

segment.source: Under the header is the main area of the app, which contains a set of configurable tool windows.
segment.target: Under the header is the main area of the app, which contains a set of configurable tool windows.

segment.source: These are intended to allow developers to customize the app to provide access to various tools and sets of information.
segment.target: These are intended to allow developers to customize the app to provide access to various tools and sets of information.

segment.source: For more details about the tools, see the following individual tool descriptions.
segment.target: For more details about the tools, see the following individual tool descriptions.

segment.source: For information about how to configure the layout and appearance of the tool windows, see the Customizing Dev Home section later on this page.
segment.target: For information about how to configure the layout and appearance of the tool windows, see the Customizing Dev Home section later on this page.

segment.source: Main menu
segment.target: Main menu

segment.source: By pressing the Menu button on your controller or navigating to the menu (“Hamburger”) button at the top left of the screen, you can access the main menu that allows you to configure the theme color and background image for the app workspace, and provide feedback on the app.
segment.target: By pressing the Menu button on your controller or navigating to the menu (“Hamburger”) button at the top left of the screen, you can access the main menu that allows you to configure the theme color and background image for the app workspace, and provide feedback on the app.

segment.source: Main menu
segment.target: Main menu

segment.source: Snap mode
segment.target: Snap mode

segment.source: Tools in Dev Home can be snapped to the side while you are running your title so that you can have easy access to tools while you are testing.
segment.target: Tools in Dev Home can be snapped to the side while you are running your title so that you can have easy access to tools while you are testing.

segment.source: To access Snap mode, select the title of the appropriate tool, press the View button on your controller, and on the context menu, select Snap.
segment.target: To access Snap mode, select the title of the appropriate tool, press the View button on your controller, and on the context menu, select Snap.

segment.source: Snap mode
segment.target: Snap mode

segment.source: Dev Home will snap right.
segment.target: Dev Home will snap right.

segment.source: You can switch context by double tapping the Nexus button as usual.
segment.target: You can switch context by double tapping the Nexus button as usual.

segment.source: Nexus
segment.target: Nexus

segment.source: Tool descriptions
segment.target: Tool descriptions

segment.source: Tool
segment.target: Tool

segment.source: Capabilities
segment.target: Capabilities

segment.source: Games & Apps
segment.target: Games & Apps

segment.source: Lists the titles and apps installed on the dev kit and the ability to quickly open them.
segment.target: Lists the titles and apps installed on the dev kit and the ability to quickly open them.

segment.source: You can also view the process lifetime management (PLM) state of games and apps, and change PLM states from a context menu.
segment.target: You can also view the process lifetime management (PLM) state of games and apps, and change PLM states from a context menu.

segment.source: Users
segment.target: Users

segment.source: Lists the users currently registered on the console.
segment.target: Lists the users currently registered on the console.

segment.source: Enables one-click user sign in/out, adding users and guests, and viewing details of users and guests.
segment.target: Enables one-click user sign in/out, adding users and guests, and viewing details of users and guests.

segment.source: Console settings
segment.target: Console settings

segment.source: Provides an “at a glance” view and editing options of console settings and information.
segment.target: Provides an “at a glance” view and editing options of console settings and information.

segment.source: Visual Studio
segment.target: Visual Studio

segment.source: Enables you to pair the console with an instance of Visual Studio to allow deployment.
segment.target: Enables you to pair the console with an instance of Visual Studio to allow deployment.

segment.source: If necessary, clear any existing paired VS instances to prevent UWP app deployment to a kit.
segment.target: If necessary, clear any existing paired VS instances to prevent UWP app deployment to a kit.

segment.source: Windows Device Portal
segment.target: Windows Device Portal

segment.source: Enables WDP (a browser-based device management tool) on the kit.
segment.target: Enables WDP (a browser-based device management tool) on the kit.

segment.source: Xbox Live status
segment.target: Xbox Live status

segment.source: Provides the current status of the Xbox Live service.
segment.target: Provides the current status of the Xbox Live service.

segment.source: Customizing Dev Home
segment.target: Customizing Dev Home

segment.source: Dev Home has been designed to be customizable and personal.
segment.target: Dev Home has been designed to be customizable and personal.

segment.source: You can choose a background image and theme color to personalize your Dev Home experience.
segment.target: You can choose a background image and theme color to personalize your Dev Home experience.

segment.source: These options are found on the main menu.
segment.target: These options are found on the main menu.

segment.source: Resizing and reordering tools
segment.target: Resizing and reordering tools

segment.source: To change the size or position of a tool, use the context menu button (View button on your controller) while the title has focus.
segment.target: To change the size or position of a tool, use the context menu button (View button on your controller) while the title has focus.

segment.source: On the context menu, select Move or Resize.
segment.target: On the context menu, select Move or Resize.

segment.source: Move or resize
segment.target: Move or resize

segment.source: Changing theme color and background image
segment.target: Changing theme color and background image

segment.source: On the main menu, you can select Change theme color.
segment.target: On the main menu, you can select Change theme color.

segment.source: To update the theme color used for focus highlighting, select a new color and then click Save.
segment.target: To update the theme color used for focus highlighting, select a new color and then click Save.

segment.source: Change theme color
segment.target: Change theme color

segment.source: Providing feedback
segment.target: Providing feedback

segment.source: To provide feedback on Dev Home, or any of the tools processes, select the Provide feedback option on the main menu.
segment.target: To provide feedback on Dev Home, or any of the tools processes, select the Provide feedback option on the main menu.

segment.source: Provide feedback
segment.target: Provide feedback

segment.source: Console settings
segment.target: Console settings

segment.source: The Console settings tool provides quick access to the settings of the dev kit.
segment.target: The Console settings tool provides quick access to the settings of the dev kit.

segment.source: Setting a hostname for the console
segment.target: Setting a hostname for the console

segment.source: When communicating with the console from your development PC, you can set a friendly name (called a hostname) for the Xbox One dev kit to use as an alternative to the console IP address.
segment.target: When communicating with the console from your development PC, you can set a friendly name (called a hostname) for the Xbox One dev kit to use as an alternative to the console IP address.

segment.source: Your development PC and the dev kit must be on the same subnet for hostname connectivity to work.
segment.target: Your development PC and the dev kit must be on the same subnet for hostname connectivity to work.

segment.source: To define a hostname for a dev kit, go to the Console settings tool and type the hostname in the Hostname box.
segment.target: To define a hostname for a dev kit, go to the Console settings tool and type the hostname in the Hostname box.

segment.source: Note Name uniqueness is not enforced when the hostname is created.
segment.target: Note Name uniqueness is not enforced when the hostname is created.

segment.source: Be careful to avoid name duplication.
segment.target: Be careful to avoid name duplication.

segment.source: One way to do this is to derive the hostname from the name of your development computer, which is usually unique within an organization.
segment.target: One way to do this is to derive the hostname from the name of your development computer, which is usually unique within an organization.

segment.source: Windows Device Portal
segment.target: Windows Device Portal

segment.source: Windows Device Portal (WDP) is a OneCore device management tool that allows a browser-based device management experience.
segment.target: Windows Device Portal (WDP) is a OneCore device management tool that allows a browser-based device management experience.

segment.source: To enable WDP on your Xbox One console:
segment.target: To enable WDP on your Xbox One console:

segment.source: Select the Dev Home tile on the home screen.
segment.target: Select the Dev Home tile on the home screen.

segment.source: Select Dev Home tile
segment.target: Select Dev Home tile

segment.source: Within Dev Home, navigate to the Remote management tool.
segment.target: Within Dev Home, navigate to the Remote management tool.

segment.source: Remote management tool
segment.target: Remote management tool

segment.source: Select Manage Windows Device Portal, and then press A.
segment.target: Select Manage Windows Device Portal, and then press A.

segment.source: Select the Enable Windows Device Portal check box.
segment.target: Select the Enable Windows Device Portal check box.

segment.source: Enter a Username and Password, and save them.
segment.target: Enter a Username and Password, and save them.

segment.source: These are used to authenticate access to your dev kit from a browser.
segment.target: These are used to authenticate access to your dev kit from a browser.

segment.source: Close the Settings page, and note the URL listed on the Remote Management tool to connect.
segment.target: Close the Settings page, and note the URL listed on the Remote Management tool to connect.

segment.source: Enter the URL in your browser, and then sign in with the credentials you configured.
segment.target: Enter the URL in your browser, and then sign in with the credentials you configured.

segment.source: You will receive a warning about the certificate that was provided, similar to the following screenshot, because the security certificate signed by your Xbox One console is not considered a well-known trusted publisher.
segment.target: You will receive a warning about the certificate that was provided, similar to the following screenshot, because the security certificate signed by your Xbox One console is not considered a well-known trusted publisher.

segment.source: Click Continue to this website to access the Windows Device Portal.
segment.target: Click Continue to this website to access the Windows Device Portal.

segment.source: Security certificate warning
segment.target: Security certificate warning

segment.target: See also

segment.target: Microsoft Developer technologies: Windows Device Portal
